result.markdown:
--- title: "Tools review for inferring cell-cell-communication interactions" --- ## Identified collaborations ### ADLab Collaborators: - Marie Pier Scott-Boyer: biological expertise - Antoine Bodein: network expertise. ### External collaborators: #### Rafael Gottardo - Suggested by Danielle Malpetti, met at the 4th Clinic Meets Data Science (CMDS) Symposium, in Zürich. - Second and mutual interest with pathway integration for improving deconvolution performances using the PLIER algorithm. #### Mark Robinson - Proficient in defining and asserting the respective pros and cons of several statistical spatial transcriptomics. - [Elixir Spatial statistics](https://github.com/elixir-europe-training/ELIXIR-SCO-spatial-omics), provided in @fig-mark-robinson. ::: {#fig-mark-robinson} {{< pdf biblio/8_Day3_spatial_stats_MarkRobinson_2025.pdf width=90% height=800 >}} ::: - Strong proficiency in developing robust benchmark's architecture: - [Omnibenchmark repository](https://omnibenchmark.org/) - [Omnibenchmark for continuous and open benchmarking in bioinformatics](https://arxiv.org/pdf/2409.17038), from [@mallona2024] - [Building a continuous benchmarking ecosystem in bioinformatics](https://arxiv.org/pdf/2409.15472), from [@mallona2024a] - [2023 Presentation to `Single Cell Plus`](https://www.birs.ca/workshops/2023/23w5090/files/Mark%20Robinson/Robinson_BIRS_benchmarking.pdf), displayed in @fig-mark-robinson2. ::: {#fig-mark-robinson2} {{< pdf biblio/Robinson_BIRS_benchmarking.pdf width=90% height=800 >}} ::: - Half-Canadian, half-Swiss - Already discussed with him attending one of the [Zürich Compbio](https://compbiozurich.org/news/) meeting. #### Yvan Saeys - Proficiency in Cell-cell-communication inference methods, as showcased by Elixir class @fig-yvan-saeys. ::: {#fig-yvan-saeys} {{< pdf biblio/9_Day4_CellCellCommuniation_YvanSaeys_2025.pdf width=90% height=800 >}} ::: - [Jupyter Notebook Tutorial on CCC](https://github.com/elixir-europe-training/ELIXIR-SCO-spatial-omics/blob/main/day_4/practical_6/workdir/p6_ccc.ipynb) - Collaborating with Julio Saez-Rodriguez lab, and recommended by Professor Mark Robinson. #### Others - Fabian Theis, with [*Modeling intercellular communication in tissues using spatial graphs of cells*](https://www.nature.com/articles/s41587-022-01467-z)'s paper, from @fischer2023nb. - Francesca Drummer - Samuel Gunz - Martin Emons (these two contacts interplay with Mark Robinson's lab) - The latter 5 associated with the following [Elixir class](https://elixir-europe-training.github.io/ELIXIR-SCO-spatial-omics/schedule.html). - Other swiss contacts: Erik van Nimwegen in Basel, Bart Deplancke in Lausanne and Sven Bergmann, Pierre-Luc Germain - Other EMBL/EBI contacts: Julio Saez Rodriguez + Pablo + Martin Garrido-Rodriguez - Laura Cantini's team on Cell-cell communication. ## TODO - **ToDo: re-use sent email to Mark Robinson** and complete collaborators section. - Finalise integration of Marie-Pier, including Table of exsiting spatial methods + add Table on single-cell approaches. - Tables of methods to be set in Appendix only, - Read reviews and benchmarks papers, add dedicated sections. - Methodological hurdles @sec-hurdles-benchmark: - Modern bootstrapping/bagging methods for simulating unknow distributions - AI tools for automated litterature review - Add litterature citations - Add real datasets approaches. --- ## List of CCC tools {#sec-ccc-tools} :::: {.content-hidden unless-format="html"} ::: {#tbl-ccc-tools .cell tbl-cap='A comprehensive overview of cell-cell-communication tools, sorted by general functionality and programming language, largely drawn from @armingol2024nrg. Report to Box 1 **Rule-based** and **data-driven** computational strategies for interpretring the variables from the table.'} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: ::: :::: ## AI-based litterature review tools{.unnumbered} Using a **ChatGPT prompt**: > "Provide me with a detailed summary of this paper, including the methodology, main findings, and comparison to existing methodologies."
